result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary N. Betley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence on Ct. 1 Withheld - 4 years probation; conditions of probation; 120 days county jail starting 04-10-2015 at 3:00pm; zero (0) days credit; AODA treatment & follow thru defendant has 30 days after release from jail to complete; fine/costs total $632.50; no contact with Wayne Halberg; restitution to Pawn America $138.50; restitution to Wayne Halberg $244.53 (restitution joint/several).  DNA sample & surcharge.  Defendant may serve in Rusk County if no cost to Sawyer County Jail.

miscConds.notes: $382.50   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; victim notification completed; advised of rights; Defendant pleads G to Ct. 1; court finds G and convicts on Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 & Ct. 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Victim addresses the court and asks to have defendant do some community service. PSI waived.   Sentence on Ct. 1 Withheld - 4 years probation; conditions of probation; 120 days county jail starting 04-10-2015 at 3:00pm; zero (0) days credit; AODA treatment & follow thru defendant has 30 days after release from jail to complete; fine/costs total $632.50; no contact with Wayne Halberg; restitution to Pawn America $138.50; restitution to Wayne Halberg $244.53 (restitution joint/several).  DNA sample & surcharge.  Defendant may serve in Rusk County if no cost to Sawyer County Jail.  Report to probation & parole today.  Plea questionnaire filed.

Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CANCEL 3-5-15 trial consolidating with Rusk Co Case, 2-24-15  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial Appearance 05/27/2014 Before Court Commissioner Ward Winton, DA Bruce Poquette - in person, Def. Zachary N. Betley w/atty Martin Jarvis
Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off the record.  Jury trial scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights; ack. receipt of information; Defendant enters NG plea on Ct. 1, 2, and 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF advised of rights, waives right to preliminary hearing,  Arraignment scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Zachary N. Betley in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  D waived preliminary hearing time limits.  State recommends $5,000 signature bond with no contact provision with Hunter Volk and Wayne Halberg.  Attorney Jarvis requests $1,000 signature bond with the no contact provision being acceptable.  Court grants State's $5,000 signature bond request with no contact with Hunter Volk and Wayne Halberg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No contact with Hunter Volk or Wayne Halberg.
